website_summaries.verdict: 6 storage capacities; fast enough to capture high-res video. Compatible with older and modern devices.
pros: good option for storing a lot of photos or video
4K and 1080p capture capabilities for clear, vivid shots
95 Mbps transfer speeds among highest of any card we considered except ultra-high-speed models
Compatible with most devices, even most older cameras

customer_reviews.title: SCAM ALERT! FAKE SD.
customer_reviews.text: IT’S A SCAM!!!! don’t buy. It’s a tiny piece of plastic made to look like an SD card. I knew right away something was wrong just by the way It looked and the weight was off. FAKE NEWS!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Cards WILL corrupt and fail. Not for professionals!
customer_reviews.text: Do not use these memory cards for any professional reason. I am a photographer and both of the Lexar "Professional" cards I ordered were corrupted and lost so many important photos. I had Christmas photos and even photos of my brother-in-law suprising his fiance with a proposal on Christmas day. EVERYTHING was lost. I even have a photo recovery program that failed to recover these photos. We are devastated and it is all because I made the mistake of trusting Lexar's inferior product. I will never purchase a Lexar product of any kind ever again. TLDR; Used these cards for photography. Both cards corrupted and failed. Please don't make the same mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: even worse than my old SD cards
customer_reviews.text: Very slow cards on my Canon 5D Mark 3, freeze after continuous shoot for 5 pictures, even worse than my old SD cards. False description, and could not return for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: YU

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY. Slower Than 5-year Old Memory Cards. Write Speeds are Laughable.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Slower than 5 year old cards I have on hand. Either it's a fake or Lexar's grossly exaggerating speeds. Never used a memory card this slow before.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: The cards are clearly bad. So
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of thef 32GB 2x packs. Of the four cards, two worked briefly and then upon trying to reformat, I received "card error" on a Fuji X-T20, a Canon T6s and a Canon 6D. The cards are clearly bad. So, given that 2 of the 4 are working (for now at least), just multiply the cost of each card x2 to factor in a replacement and you might be ok...
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid write protection switch prone to failure.
customer_reviews.text: Failed after one week. I would avoid. The write protect switch is low quality and prone to failure. After one week's use the card thinks it is write protected with the switch in either position rendering the card useless.
customer_reviews.author: Veritatis cupitor

customer_reviews.title: Not good for my DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Review Updated on 2019-07-18. I ran the test with DiskMark and I got speeds below advertised but performance in real world is even worst: I use this one to shoot photos with a Canon Rebel T6 (also know as Canon 1300D in some countries) and the card is unable to keeping up with my camera. I was shooting RAW+JPG LARGE and when you do continuous shooting, then card will say BUSY, please see video carefully on top of the DSLR screen (I have also added a photo). NOTE: In pictures you will see damaged package but please consider that I bought in that condition from Amazon Warehouse so I do not complain about that little issue.
customer_reviews.author: JARELLANO

customer_reviews.title: Maximum speed for my camera, without maximum price
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit of internet research, but I found the maximum read and write speeds for my digital camera (Sony a6000)...and they weren't as high as I'd expected. Fortunately, this saved me from buying some Super Ultra Mega Turbo Platinum Edition memory cards, at 5x the cost. These were a great purchase, and will probably long outlive my camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a professional photographer and was horrified when I put the card into my DSLR- it felt a little off going in, and when I applied pressure to remove it, it was STUCK. I was able to remove it, tried it in an old camera, and again, it didn't really "bounce" out of the slot. I was able to remove with my nail, but I would never recommend or risk using this card. Lexar makes alright products, but this is definitely not one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Grace T.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CARD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this card to use with my Canon T6. It took great pictures on cruise to British Isles and then another set of pictures for my 70th birthday. Now card thinks it is write protected. I can't unlock it. Write switch moves freely but no matter which position it is in, card says it is "locked". Will not format. Worse than cheap cards I have purchased at Walmart. Problem is this says it is for "professional" and I depended on it and AMAZON, BUT IT IS EITHER FAKE OR JUST PLAIN AWFUL.
customer_reviews.author: acnp2b

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waster your money on this card! This "professional " memory card will corrupt literally within minutes of use. After taking 2 photos, it suddenly says "out of memory". So I reformatted the card AGAIN and tried to take another photo only to be told again "out of memory". These cards are DEFECTIVE! I'm in the process of trying to contact the seller, depending on what they say and how they resolve the issue, aa to whether or not I update this review. My hopes are not high on that based on other's reviews......
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Corrupt after less than 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my 5D Mark IV and have noticed slow write speeds during sessions. Less than 5 months after I purchased it, suddenly it was "write protected" still in camera while I was taking photos of a birthday party. Thankfully I was able to get the photos imported, but I can't format it or erase the contents on it now. This card is now corrupt and completely useless. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: MonMTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Broken card!  Buy elsewhere!
customer_reviews.text: Card was BROKEN!! As in, fully intact but completely unusable! Which, by the way, I only figured out once on my trip to Italy (my fault, I should've tested it beforehand, but forgot). Thankfully I had a spare card but I was NOT a happy camper. The last thing anyone wants to deal with on their trip is something like this. Don't know whose fault it is Crucial Technology's or Lexar's and really care as this is UNACCEPTABLE either way. You can't be selling people broken cards, are you kidding?!? Now I have to waste my time and go to the post office to send this thing back to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These cards are fast!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card for an older digital camera that, when set to RAW, had a delay processing. so you couldn't snap a photo and be ready for the next for a few seconds. In photography, a few seconds means you could miss the perfect shot! I decided to get a faster read and write speed card and this one did the job! No more delay issues and 32gb of storage! Works perfectly and quick!
customer_reviews.author: Bill R Littlejohn

customer_reviews.title: Super Slow WRITE speed!!! = 20mb/sec  Don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card because it says the speed is 95mb/sec. I looked everywhere for where the WRITE speed is, and it's not listed anywhere, not even in Lexar's website. So I made the wrong conclusion that the 95mb/sec written on the card is the write speed. WRONG! I found out the hard way that this card is too slow to shoot multiple shots with. I called Lexar customer service and they told me that the write speed is 20mb/sec. They are hiding this important piece of information on purpose. Something only a shiester would do. Don't buy this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: The man who likes to read

customer_reviews.title: Lexar is good stuff, but....
customer_reviews.text: Where's the little protective cases for the SD cards? Come on, all you manufacturers! We appreciate having them, and NOT having to order them separately. They can't cost you more than two bits apiece! SD cards are good for long term storage. The cases are needed. These 32 GB cards are more than sufficient for my two smaller cameras, and I'll be using them until the cows come home. Then I'll take their pictures too.
customer_reviews.author: ActiveShooter

customer_reviews.title: Storage on the cheap
customer_reviews.text: I shoot with a Fujifilm XT-3 and a Pentax K50. With modern DSLR's and mirrorless cameras I end up shooting both pictures (primarily) and video (on occasion). These cards have the throughput to allow me to shoot in burst mode at sporting events and record the images to camera without buffering issues. Additionally, while I have had some corruption issues with other cards, this Lexar brand has been flawless for me so far. They provide a good deal of storage at a reasonable cost and they are my go to brand of choice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris HamiltonTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Too slow for modern DSLR
customer_reviews.text: This card is classed and rated better than a card of a different brand that I own, but its performance is obviously slower. I tried to shoot burst mode with a Canon 6D MkII, and it was good for about 8-10 shots before the camera had to stop and wait. That has never happened with my other card. I could even tell a difference when shooting rapidly in single-shot mode. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: One worked Fine...One was DEAD out of the package
customer_reviews.text: and I just opened up the package for the Cleveland Irish Fest in July 18......That really scared me I had another transend in my case....that is what I usually get but there were the same price better speed! Camera would recognize it wanted to format it and formatting continued for 30 min and not done!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I just pulled the battery and switched out the card I've never had a SD card that I put in my camera demand to be formatted got home and the puter did the same thing! BAD CARD!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gypsymuse

customer_reviews.title: Mine tested out well
customer_reviews.text: I didn't read the reviews before I bought mine, so I didn't realize there were fakes out there. I ran FakeFlashTest and the capacity checked out fine. So then I ran the time consuming H2TESTW software which took about 2 hours and got a write speed of 17 MB/s, well below the claimed 45MB/s. That could be limited by the SD card reader speed on my 2017 Dell Inspiron 5767 laptop, and I'm sure it will be sufficient for my Fujifilm X-T100. I think I'd buy another even given the risks of fakes. Amazon is good about returns.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Simon

customer_reviews.title: Have purchased 2 -- both have been problematic
customer_reviews.text: In the past couple of years, I've purchased two of these. The first lasted a bit over a year; worked beautifully, but then began separating; front/back started to literally come apart and could no longer be used. A second was ordered, and the card stopped being read by camera and computer by the third month. Have moved on...
customer_reviews.author: Amy Skattebo

customer_reviews.title: Physical Design Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Because the physical design of the chip has a natural crease running from the two indents on the top sides; therefor, these chips are likely to bend, crease, or snap along this line (Right under the 32GB on the chip) -- This has happened to two of my chips (Both this same brand / design). Go with a different chip that does not have the two little indents across from one another so that you do not run the risk of having a broken or bent chip permanently trapping your data.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, slow slow speed card
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed by the product. As a 95MB/sec card it should record and read with no issues. But it keeps stopping the recording after 10 seconds or when trying to preview the image it cannot load the full image on the camera screen. Either these cards are fale or they placed a different stickers on a slower cards. I had the same speed card from the same company before and never had issues. Waste of money for this sd cards.
customer_reviews.author: Arken Avan

customer_reviews.title: Just what the picture ordered
customer_reviews.text: One of the best deals around. I like these cards the best of all brands as long as I remember to NEVER DELETE ANY FILES IN CAMERA. When I’ve done that in the past, a good number of the keepers will be mysteriously corrupted and unrecoverable. Could be my personal experience but it has happened in different camera bodies so I expect that just happens. Don’t delete files while the card is in camera, REFORMAT your cards after you’ve downloaded all.
customer_reviews.author: Cia de Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Good card but doesn't come with plastic storage holder!  How cheap can you be Lexar?
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of these cards for use in my solid state audio recorder. Card works fine. But I was surprised that Lexar doesn't include any form of plastic storage holder for this card. Now I'm off to buy several SD card storage holders. Be sure to add that cost and hassle to the total price of buying Lexar! I'll be buying another brand in the future to escape Lexar's bottom of the barrel packaging.
customer_reviews.author: P. R.. Fectionist

customer_reviews.title: This card ruined me. I shot my first wedding ...
customer_reviews.text: This card ruined me. I shot my first wedding in march. I had to wait a few weeks to put the images on my laptop since I was waiting for an external hard drive. When I stuck the card into my laptop there was no response. Not a single card reader could identify this card. It is not physically damaged at all. I made sure to treat this card well, and it was only 6-8 months old. I took it into a repair shop and they couldn't pull off my images either. I will never be buying this brand again, it ruined my first wedding photography experience.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Read the fine print: 95 READ speed, 45 write speed.
customer_reviews.text: If you just need a ton of storage and don’t need ultra fast write speeds this is a good value SD card. But be warned: I bought a bunch of these for shooting in 4K and for some reason my video clips only took for a few seconds. That’s because the cards have a read speed of 95mbs which ensures flawless playback of anything recorded on to it so long as you can write at 45mbs. That’s just barely enough if you’re shooting UHD in low bits. If you’re shouting professionally with a 4K 18bit +, this SD card will ruin your shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Ian B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Lexar memory cards. Professional quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Lexar memory cards for 20 years. They always were very reliable. Lately the prices have been coming down and they are now sold at a very cheap price. I now buy new cards every time they get full instead of reusing them. I just archive the cards after I download them to my computer or portable hard drives. They make great back-ups just in case of an emergency and the computer or garden drive crashes. Perfect quality. Works very well. Good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: RANDALL B. WELLS

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but what happened to the storage case?
customer_reviews.text: The same high quality Lexar product that I am use do; I knocked it down 1 star because a plastic case is no longer provided. Fine when the card is in the camera, but not so fine when you take it out and want to keep it in a safe place.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best capacity, speed and value for video as well as stills.
customer_reviews.text: Look no further; this is the best deal. Capacity PER CARD: @ 10 MB: 9,999 stills @ 20 MB: 7,871 stills @ RAW: 2,489 stills Video: 11 Hours, 32 Min. (My camera is a Sony a6000 mirrorless; yours may vary some) These are XC cards, which are supposedly better for video. 95 MB/second is plenty fast enough. The 64 MB is more than enough for all, especially if shooting RAW for post-editing.
customer_reviews.author: Papabri

customer_reviews.title: Fast card; works best in my Lumix for videos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the size. I wanted a 32 Mb card and my previously preferred brand (Sandisk) wasn't available. I tried this on spec. I noticed that it transferred to the computer wicked fast and slickly smooth. I put it in my Lumix ZS70 and the glitches on playback seemed to go away. The next best card (64 Gb Sandisk Extreme) went from the Lumix to the Olympus mirrorless, which I don't tend to use for video.
customer_reviews.author: wjt

customer_reviews.title: Lexar these days...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been pleased with lexar these days. This card isn't very fast for modern cameras (a77ii, a99ii). I used it mostly on the a77ii, which doesn't produce huge files and I haven't had problems with speed, but I did have periodic problems with Sony cameras failing to transfer the file from buffer to the card. This problem didn't occur on the more expensive Lexars or Sandisk. These cards also feel flimsy and there is a lot of flex.
customer_reviews.author: E!

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting for this size to come out. This SDXC, and the SanDisk micro SDXC, are the only 1TB cards made. They are both manufacturers of quality SD cards. Having experience with several brands, I have had some inexpensive cards fail with too much read/write activity at one time. You’ll spend a little more, but in the end not losing your precious files is worth it. I’ve also experienced slow write operations on lower grade cards. When transferring and backing up data, how much is your time worth? This Lexar SD card works flawlessly. I keep a large library of mp4/aac music files on an SD card for portability. It also frees up space on the internel drives.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Naprstek

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a few of the Lexars in 16, 32 and 64 gb. I use them with my point and shoot cameras and DSLRs. I have had no problems with them. I do transfer photos and videos from the card to my laptops. I then reformat the Lexar in the camera and use them again. The Lexar works well on my Nikons and Canon point and shoots. I would gladly purchased the Lexars again.
customer_reviews.author: dtech

customer_reviews.title: The Lexar's are the best. I have had probably a dozen different brands ...
customer_reviews.text: The Lexar's are the best. I have had probably a dozen different brands over the years and these have NEVER failed. Others such as SONY and even Sandisk have had problems. Just make sure to buy these from a reliable source, there are conterfeits (of all brands) out there.
customer_reviews.author: vtouch

customer_reviews.title: 256GB card seems to work better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I almost cancelled this order before getting it delivered after reading so many bad reviews. I am not sure if some bad batch got mixed in there, but mine is working well with Nikon D5600. I can do burst shots, 4K video recording, etc. without any issue. Only downside is that reading may take a bit sometimes after burst shots, but they are all there. I don't really review photos as much on the LCD panel, so it doesn't bother me. However, you may want something with faster read/write if you do. For money's worth, I like it. I'll update the review after using it for a while and compare with some other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Best price so far and works great
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before purchasing these, I take thousands of pictures of my kids only because I’m using continuous shooting mode for sports so I need large capacity cards that I can switch in and out quickly these so far have worked perfectly and from my research they work great with most cameras I have tried them and both my Cannon and my Sony. I purchased three so that at any time I have an available card
customer_reviews.author: JLKOhioTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Best DEAL!
customer_reviews.text: This was a seriously awesome deal the cards write VERY quickly and if I am doing long exposures I have noticed that the processing time to preview the image on the LCD of the DSLR has cut down quite a bit. I have a dual SD card slot DSLR so the added memory of having a 2 pack was a HUGE bonus, this would have been triple the price if i had purchased them in a department store! Don't even sit and think about this deal it's absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin A. Acosta

customer_reviews.title: So. Much. Space.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Sony A7rii where the photos are 42mp and I haven't ever run out of room. I format the card after every shoot and nothing has gone wrong. My shoots usually go up to 1000+ photos and there's not been any problem when using this card. A better investment than having multiple cards IMO if you backup frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: A great memory card
customer_reviews.text: It is a great card, I use it in my point and shot camera and had no problems, plus it does a great job on video shot with the camera. Very quick and no errors as of yet, which I hope there is none. Would recommend this card and it arrived very quickly and I have taken about 400 pictures on it and there is still plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Guyer

customer_reviews.title: The locking mechanism is broke.
customer_reviews.text: This is a two pack deal. I bought because of the brand name LEXAR. Well one of out of the two is malfunctioning. I was able to get my images off the card. Every time I try to use the card my camera states the safty locking level is activated but it's not. Anyway guess you get what you pay for. I'm going to Sony. I can't afford to loose important images.
customer_reviews.author: matthew louie

customer_reviews.title: Bummed one failed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the two-pack. One card just failed yesterday after a year. I had just formatted it and my computer would not read the new files. All other SD cards work...reshot with same camera with another card and it worked fine. Reformatted another card...computer read files on it. So...I guess I'm going back to SanDisk, which has never failed.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: Will record 4K (60mbs modes) on a6400
customer_reviews.text: This will record 4K video in the 60mb/s modes in a Sony A6400. Tested and confirmed on 24 and 30p. Also works well for stills, but be prepared for burst shots to take a few seconds to load. A great buy for backup SHTF cards... just know the limitations. I keep these in my cases in case I forget my better cards.
customer_reviews.author: P. Carney

customer_reviews.title: Great for use in camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, it is fast and clicking and storing picture on my Canon does not take long like before. Have been using this on my camera for month without any problems. I have not put the memory directly inside the laptop but downloading over the camera's wifi works without a problem and is faster
customer_reviews.author: CYBERTRON

customer_reviews.title: Black Friday helped me score some great SD cards!
customer_reviews.text: Got an amazing deal on these for Black Friday! They perform amazing in my Nikon D750 and store over 5k jpegs when shooting with my full frame lenses! They kept up great when shooting continuously during some action photos at my daughters dance recital. Will definitely keep an eye out for deals like this again so I can get some backups!
customer_reviews.author: RICH

customer_reviews.title: I am satisfied with quality and performance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two new cards when I bought my new OMD -E-M5 III, my older San Disk cards were acting a bit wonky. They appear to work as specified in the Amazon listing. I don't know if they are 'genuine', or not. How can the consumer REALLY know with absolute certainty? However, in terms of performance, they do appear to be as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: GBarrington

customer_reviews.title: Super fast!
customer_reviews.text: I only noticed their speed the moment when I left them at home accidentally when going to a photoshoot. These SD Card are lighting fast, I can shoot with my Nikon D5300 really fast and if I need to see the picture, I watch the display and the image it's there (I mention this because with my older SD, after I take a photo, I must wait 2-5 seconds for the picture to load), by the way, I shoot in RAW.
customer_reviews.author: Nolda Casanova

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SD storage product
customer_reviews.text: Way back when when I started using SD cards, I never imagined having this much storage space. I've used this product in 2 of my Digital cameras and it seems to work quite well. No real issues and/or no real problems to report. Just a reliable SD card that works very well and delivers. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: The Tusk

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that I did not receive the cards from the first purchase as they were lost in transit and they were a gift. However, I was refunded quickly after it was determined they were lost. I reordered and received them in 2 days as expected. So far they are working great. The price was great for the size of the cards.
customer_reviews.author: sbama4ever

customer_reviews.title: Does the job in Canon 70D, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Why almost 5/5: Love this SD card. I can just bring one now on video shoots and know I won't run out of space. Why 4/5: However, actual usable space is closer to 465GB, just so you know. Knocked a start for this, because THAT much difference is a little bit annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I received a used DSLR camera for a gift and wanted a much larger card than the one that was received with the camera. I bought two and am not at all disappointed. While I might buy one a bit larger specifically for video, these do well and I can even record some decent short videos.
customer_reviews.author: HiPowerShooter

customer_reviews.title: Tons of storage space for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This memory card is doing an excellent job in my digital camera. Even shooting in both RAW and highest quality JPEG I can fit 2,300 pictures on it. Plus I've been able to fire off several shots in a row and not had to wait for the buffer to catch up. When paired with a USB 3.0 memory card reader I've copied 100+ photos over to my computer in a matter of seconds so the transfer speed is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Easterbrooks

customer_reviews.title: Another defect from Amazon fulfillment
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have read even the top five reviews on this card. Got card today, my Canon cannot format the card. It is one of the defective, or counterfeit ones I guess. This is the third item in the past 2 months that is Amazon fulfilled and defective. The first two were cameras that were OBVIOUSLY defective. Can’t trust Amazon to deliver good products anymore...
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hope

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable memory
customer_reviews.text: Bought this over some of the less expensive SD cards due to ratings and speed specs. So far, appears to be reliable. The less expensive cards seemed to stop working or started having file faults when rewritten a number of times. This SD card, so far, seems to be fast and reliable - worth a few more dollars, and yet still not very expensive.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Deal
customer_reviews.text: In photography, you sometimes need redundancy; a back up when taking event photos. The speed isn't the fastest, but for my D610, this is as fast as the camera can support. So anything faster is a waste of money. Thus far, I have had no transfer issues or write issues.
customer_reviews.author: Nib Guru

customer_reviews.title: Unusable defective Lexar 32 GB disk
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a package with TWO Lexar Professional 32GB size. Was scheduled to use both on photography trip during the past two weeks. Found out that One disk worked fine, the SECOND disk told me it could not be used because it "may be damaged". Attempting to Format it could not be done either to check it that would solve problem. Is there a way to get this damaged disk returned or replaced ??
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about an item like this other than it works. I am using a pair of these cards in one of my Nikon dSLRs. The new cards are backup. They say, "Not if but when" a media card fails. I've never experienced a fail, but thought a backup pair is just smart.
customer_reviews.author: L'Chaim the Maggid

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for household inventory
customer_reviews.text: We recently completed a household inventory room by room. I purchased this SD card so that the items can be stored in our safe-deposit box. The card works perfectly, and because my camera has a larger than normal megapixel count, the 64GB was the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Judy A Ascenzi

customer_reviews.title: fast!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, I can get my pictures off of it quickly as long as I am using usb 3 connection. Also, tested this on my older SLR and was able to transfer raw files from the camera to the card within 9 seconds after the camera buffer filled up, older SD cards would take up to 30 seconds. I've been using it regularly for the last 6 months and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: It serves the purpose for which it was purchased
customer_reviews.text: I use this device to download material for a friend who does not have internet access. This allows to both load temporary material and to store material for future reference. The 64gb capacity allows for a lot of storage of the material we work with.
customer_reviews.author: gbunny

customer_reviews.title: Solid performer for HD video recording
customer_reviews.text: Not as happy since Lexar sell-off from Micron, but card works as advertised. This card has no problems recording 1080p HD 4:2:2 video. Overall, I have no complaints with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt W.

customer_reviews.title: Works in my camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my Sony digital camera. The price tag is phenomenal and I was able to use the Micro SD (had an adapter) in a device that only supports Micro SD. The full sized cards are just so much cheaper so when I can, I use those and use the Micro when I have to.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: Holds a ton of photos
customer_reviews.text: I've taken over 2000 RAW images on my camera and the card still was not full. I don't know what the max is because the most I've taken in a weekend was around 2300. I carry both cards with me so I'm sure you can easily hold over 5000 RAW images with these two.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Annell

customer_reviews.title: Huge memory capacity and super fast transfer speed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new camera that takes massive 16 megapixel photos, but it "only" came with a 32 GB memory card. This 128 GB card is super fast and should hold a few years worth of maximum resolution pictures. I don't even know what the "Image Rescue 5" software is but hopefully I won't ever need to figure that out. I do know large memory capacity and high speed are very important for high res digital photography, and this has both.
customer_reviews.author: BKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lagged while reviewing photos..
customer_reviews.text: It is rated at 95MB/s, same as my other Sandisk SD. However, the speed is dropped down when I was reviewing the photos on my Canon 80D. Lagging and take long time to browse through photos (sometimes its just like frozen) this never happen with my other card, and I was shooting RAW in both cases. I doubt the speed of 95MB/s.
customer_reviews.author: Phantomas

customer_reviews.title: When storage capacity, speed and reliability are key, choose this SDHC, for your video needs.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Panasonic 3CCD digital HDD videocamera that only accepts up to an SDHC style card, as opposed to accepting SDXC cards, for instance, and that means 32GB is the top end for storage on my camera, as far as removable media, and this Lexar 633x 32GB SDHC does the the trick for my video needs. I needed something fast, reliable and of highest capacity. Very satisfied with this product thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl & Norma Wilson

customer_reviews.title: it is cracked
customer_reviews.text: cracked in package looks like something heavy was put on it in shipping! not sure but didn't need to open it out of its package to see this is broke and only option is to drive somewhere to return it will cost me more in the long run then it cost me no thanks!.
customer_reviews.author: wayne d

customer_reviews.title: Slow write speed
customer_reviews.text: For single photos this works as expected. However, I was shooting Bursts of a bull riding and it writes very slowly. I used a Canon 77d which is not exceptionally fast. Action shots with a fast camera would be frustrating. for single shots it performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Belgian Man

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Card used on a 3Ds
customer_reviews.text: Really affordable card to hold all my 3Ds games on. You will have to convert it to FAT32 since that is what a Nintendo 3Ds reads.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Watch out!
customer_reviews.text: This card is bad, i bought it as a back up card, i think i used 4 times in one year and now is broken, computer doesn't recognize... i tried to format it, didn't work, because this memoy card have 10 years warranty, i asked amazon & seller for a replacement for a new card with no success. Just try other brand and other seller, this cards aren't safe.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Segui

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Nikon D camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving a 1 star because it wont allow anything less if I had a choice it be no stars . I ordered this for my Nikon camera in prep for my baby girls delivery. Was very disappointed when we opened and got everything together at the hospital and kept telling me memory needed to be cleared and set up to be done all the hassle we went thru and it never even ended up working. Luckily I found a old memory card in my case that we were able to use or I would had been very upset if we had missed capturing my daughters birth .
customer_reviews.author: TISH

customer_reviews.title: Best SD Card For Portrait Photography
customer_reviews.text: I like these SD cards from Lexar. They are inexpensive and easy to find online. I shoot mostly headshots in our studio which does not require fast buffering time. I don't shoot action so these cards work perfectly for my photography business. I will continue to buy this brand of SD cards for my Sony a7ii.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rives

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to SD card for my cameras
customer_reviews.text: This card offers a good melding of performance, capacity and price. I've used them in my M240, my GFX50R, and my 5DS with great results. Note: I don't shoot video or sports, so if you do your performance needs may be greater than mine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Armijo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with some older devices
customer_reviews.text: I mean maybe it's my fault for not researching, but I didn't look into this particular type of SD card and the compatibility of what I needed it for. I have an older DSLR camera (Pentax K-x) and it didn't work with this newer type of SD card. So just make sure this is compatible with what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie Lynn

customer_reviews.title: lousy packaging
customer_reviews.text: I by Lexar sd cards for the quality. I just got two Lexar 128gb 1000x and like them. You pay more but you get more. However, the 128gb 633x are not cheap but don't even come with a plastic storage case for them. Lexar couldn't have spent 10 more cents to actually give me a storage case?
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Karger

customer_reviews.title: working ability none
customer_reviews.text: was for my security cam does not work wont record anything so i have to find another use for it and hope that works nothing works its a fake a scam do not ever buy from these people EVER scamers does not work at all empty shell 😒 very disgusting people.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson-Goode

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, no problems
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it to put on several things that I need to share with others. Easier to put into a laptop than the USB sticks - most of us have to use those outlets to set up a presentation. This is faultless, and fast
customer_reviews.author: I Like to Do Stuff

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Fast and functional. no issues so far since I bought the a couple months ago
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Bought 3, and they're not fake.
customer_reviews.text: I know a year or so ago there must have been a bunch of counterfeits in Amazon's supply chain, but I just bought 3 of these 512GB cards at a fantastic price and they work great and by all appearances are genuine. I haven't tested them for max speed because I'm using them in a non-photography application (iPod conversion), but they perform as well or better than the Sandisk 256GB cards they replaced in that application.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement for my Own Memory
customer_reviews.text: This memory card has helped me so much, and now I don't worry about storing all of my photos in my mind's eye. This is a alleviated a lot of stress, as trying to describe all of my photos (of cardboard boxes and street signs) in the same detail that I remembered them, seemed to make my dates disappear...something I realized after I came out of my trancelike state I enter when describing these works of art.
customer_reviews.author: Waltar Ego

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Their isn't much to say about an SD card, besides the fact that it does its job fine. It reads very fast even for my D850 for 42Mp with 50mb raw files. 64GB is good enough for me to use when in shooting landscape, and I never had Lexar card fell on me. Probably I’ll get on next level Lexar when the price go down and need more faster card.
customer_reviews.author: Petar P

customer_reviews.title: Bought four, all of them are defective.
customer_reviews.text: Don't make the same mistake I did and miss out on recordings due to defective SD cards. These are absolute Garbage... I had some formatting issues with the SanDisk 32 gig 80mbs cards and thought I'd give Lexar Cards a try. BIG MISTAKE - Cannot get the cards to remain active in the card reader or move files off of them. Checked permissions, went through troubleshooting and nothing works. Stick with Sandisk, or your favorite brand. I'm betting the failure rate will be far lower.
customer_reviews.author: foodiggity

customer_reviews.title: Knock off card
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to find this for fair price. Until I realized it was a fake!! I had wondered why my pictures were uploading kinds crappy, thought maybe was just my computer, as I've never had this problem anyways. I compared the card to my other lexar card and they're NOT the same. Returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Jocy Warner

customer_reviews.title: A little problem first time
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why, but I had problems when I first used it. The laptop refused to read the 64GB card. I bought this for a full frame Pentax camera. Now cards works well, but I am not sure that this is a fail-safe
customer_reviews.author: Den

customer_reviews.title: I also have a Lexar 2000x - which is extremely ...
customer_reviews.text: I also have a Lexar 2000x - which is extremely fast, This does OK ~ 45 MB/sec writing, large files (500MB and larger). The 2000x is near 180 MB/sec. The prices of the 633x's are more affordable though.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Covney

customer_reviews.title: Cheap 256GB card. But slow as hell !
customer_reviews.text: Got this thinking, how bad could they be ? well, pretty bad. Good thing I got them for very cheap... Also, wouldn't rely on their durability...
customer_reviews.author: Thierry Brouard

customer_reviews.title: Woot!
customer_reviews.text: Added a bit of pep to my aging Canon 550D (Rebel t2i) - 64 GB of space is no joke, so glad I went with a professional grade SD card this time. Been using them for about a year now, no issues. I swap one card for the other as necessary, I like to keep all my pictures on my SD cards until I'm ready to print just in case the desktop decides to eat something important.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea DeChaos

customer_reviews.title: My favorite SD cards!
customer_reviews.text: My go to for SD cards! I always trust Lexar more than any other card brand. I’ve been using the same 64gb cards for years and they never fail. Great for shooting RAW, as they have plenty of space, but not too much! Having 95MB/s is great for shooting sports or concerts. There’s not a lot of good SD cards that work that fast, and I have had my camera lock up because they don’t work fast enough. This one works well and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: V. D.

customer_reviews.title: Always have a spare.
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the performance of these cars unless you go to XQD cards. The built in recovery software is a safety net I wish I have had in the past. I will never buy another car that doesn't have it. The price was right as well. Never go to a shoot without multiple backup cards. When one fails, it always seems to be at the most inopportune time, and when you don't have a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Defective card
customer_reviews.text: This card did not work in my camera. Unfortunately I didn't try it before I left for my cruise and I was unable to take pictures for my cruise vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Dellecese

customer_reviews.title: Sad.
customer_reviews.text: If there was a way to give 0 stars, I would. If you value pictures, please choose a different brand card. I ordered two cards, we used the first one to take pictures of my sister's wedding. All of the pictures are ruined because it is a corrupt card. I will not even be opening the second one. Please. Do not waste your money on this brand. It is so heart breaking to end up with ruined pictures of an important time in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival: 62MB not 512 GB
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival, only showing 62MB of storage not 512 GB, formatted multiple times using multiple devices including SD card formatters and disk utility and still only 62 MB. Beware of Lexar!
customer_reviews.author: LA101

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Not sure about this
customer_reviews.text: I got tons of errors on my PC reading this card. Hasn’t happened with any other card. Works in the camera, but the computer says it’s always empty or can’t see anything in the folders.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Jax

customer_reviews.title: Easyest way to add more space
customer_reviews.text: I have a 200 SSD Laptop, and am always low on space. I added this to the SD slot and moved all my files and now I have more than half the space cleared. Works very fast, and able to store all my music on it.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Great storage
customer_reviews.text: I have a new DSLR so I now shoot in RAW and store both RAW and JPG pics. I have all of my vacation pics from 2 months on the disk plus others (over 4000) and it is not quite half full!
customer_reviews.author: Liz S

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking card.
customer_reviews.text: Shows it works fine on PC. Unfortunately doesn’t work on my camera being that my camera has a max capacity of 32 GB and this one is 64 GB
customer_reviews.author: Mord

customer_reviews.title: It's SD not micro SD
customer_reviews.text: For some reason I thought that it's micro SD, and just SD case, so I have to return it. Size is correct , see Check Flash picture. Writing speed is a bit slow, I expected 60Mb/s, but got 35Mb/s.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought these SD cards as spare storage for my camera. So far they are doing great and at 8M per photo for 20M resolution, it is showing that I can store 6,100 images on a card. I'm impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Steffi

customer_reviews.title: Test product immediately!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I bought these too long ago to return but one of them is defective. I just opened the package during my sons football game and it said their was an error with the card. Very dissatisfied and disappointed that I am out this money. Spent $35 on the pack of 2 and only one worked so Im out half the funds.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good cards
customer_reviews.text: I like Lexar cards, and have never had problems with them. I hate the packaging. You need scissors or a knife to get the cards out and in the process the paper insert is easily destroyed. I realize the packaging is to prevent shoplifting but nobody can shoplift at Amazon anyway. Other than the rant about poor packaging design, I recommend these cards. They are my first choice in most cases.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Hall

product_meta.title: Lexar Professional 633x 32GB SDHC UHS-I Card (LSD32GCB1NL633)
product_meta.description: Style:Single| Capacity:32GBDesigned for your mid-range DSLR, an HD camcorder, 3D camera, Lexar Professional 633x SDHC/SDXC UHS-I cards let you quickly capture, and transfer high-quality photos of stunning 1080p Full-HD, 3D, and 4K video, with read speeds of up to 633x (95MB/s). These Class 10 cards leverage UHS-I technology to deliver high-speed performance. And when using a USB 3.0 card reader, you’ll power through post-production with high-speed card-to-computer file transfer. This dramatically accelerates workflow from start to finish, so you can save time and get back to the business of photography.
feature_bullets: High-speed, Class 10 performance—leverages UHS-I (U1 or U3 depending on capacity) technology for a read transfer speed up to 95MB/s (633x).
Capture high quality images of stunning 1080p full-HD, 3D, and 4K video
Enjoy shooting longer without changing cards—large capacity options up to 1TB
High-speed file transfer from card to computer to dramatically accelerate workflow

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars10,085 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
